CatDescriptText: Mr. Elmer Pollard, unemployed clerical worker, 1100 Cresswell St., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "We should push forward for cemetery integration as well as in every other field."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elmer Pollard wearing thin moustache, dark knit tie, and glen plaid jacket
